td.p: Thomson, John. Journal, Mackenzie River, 1800-1802. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0021

div.p: 5 Placettes[,] 1 Depraille, 3 origl noses, 3 skins grease, 2 of pounded Meat, 1 of Fatt 5 of hare Snares[,] 1 of origl collets[.] The hunters came back from the other side, they brought all the Snares as they say there is no hares to be seen in that quarter.

Friday the 5th[.] Gave out including the balance of their old Debts 213 skins on Credit – & for nothing 2 Awls & 3 flints[.] They all went away except one young Man that is Sick – he remains with the Little Chief untill he grows better[.] Sent the young Men to set their Snares[.]

Wednesday the 10th[.] The Little Chief & all his familly decamped from here, as they are not able to Live any longer having destroyed all the hares around their Encampment – on account of his former greatness he still thinks himself entitled to some attention, therefore gave him 1½ foot tobacco[.] The sick Man asked leave to remain untill tomorrow, he Traded 3 skins of Dried & 1 Pounded Meat[.] Sent Martin to the Young Mens Encampment to see what they are doing, at Sunset he came back with them, they brought 90 hares[.]

Thursday the 11th[.] Sent Martin & 2 young Men to the Grand Lac or further if he finds necessary in quest of the Slaves of that quarter[.] There is near one half of the Indians there about, they do not yet know of our being here, & as they do little or nothing at this Season, it will make them more Industrious to come here now with what few skins they have in order to get more Credits &c[.] The young Men report the nearest to be Ten days march off[.] Sent Martin a gun, 10 Meas Amunition[,] 6 Awls[,] 4 flints, 1 Skin Beads, 1 fire steel[,] 1 g. worm & 1 fath Tobacco – also 30lbs dry Meat, 18 of Pounded, 7 of grease, 3 cascamisks & 10 hares & gave the y Men each the value of 3 kins in triffles[.] A young Man & 2 Boys arrived, gave them Drams & pieces of Tobc[,] the former paid 19 Skins Credits & Traded 1 Marten[,] 1 Weazel[,]
